title: Completed PE Summary - Balmoral
raw_html:
Category Merchant
Registered Owner & Manager: Waverly Steam
Port of registry: Bristol
Flag: UK
Type: Passenger vessel
Built: 1949
Construction: Steel
Length overall: 62.03
Gross tonnage: 735.00
Date & Time 24/08/05 15:12
Location of incident: Swansea harbour area
Incident Type: Grounding
Persons onboard: 20 crew
Injuries/ fatalities: None
Damage/ Pollution: Material Damage

Synopsis

The passenger vessel Balmoral was navigating the main channel entering the port of Swansea, South Wales, when she ran aground close to the Swansea inner fairway buoy. The vessel sustained damage to the bottom plates which resulted in flooding to a void space. There were no passengers on board at the time of the incident.

Action taken:

The Chief Inspector has written to the vessel's owners and made two recommendations:

  • Enhance WEL's current bridge team management training program, to ensure all masters and relief masters have successfully completed the course before assuming command of the company's vessels.

  • Develop a personnel monitoring and appraisal system which will allow WEL management to determine the competence level of an individual, and accurately assess their suitability for promotion or prior to a specific appointment.
